page.title: 08FARMING - INTERVIEW 3
page.content: Interview by W.I.group. This fruit farm is situated approx. at map ref.87,34 and 88,35. It is owned by a Trust in Leicester which provides flatlet accommodation for elderly citizens of the town. The 800 acres are mainly arable. Crops are grains,potatoes,sugar beet,peas(sold as frozen),strawberries,raspberries and gooseberries. There is a herd of Charolais cattle. The soft fruit side is partly 'pick your own' and partly picked for the trade. The prolonged frost in l984/5 winter and the extensive rain in May 1985, causing the lower fields near canal to flood, have damaged soft fruit crops. Picking season lasts about 5 weeks. The season this year is late because the first flowers were killed by frost and wet.
